class_notes: Criminal Law, Criminal Procedure, & International Law will be helpful
course_description: Transnational criminal procedure describes the intersection of two or more domestic criminal justice systems across international borders. Topics covered include: extradition and rendition, extraterritorial application of United States criminal law on matters such as public corruption and human trafficking, cross-border evidence-gathering, counterterrorism, special jurisdiction treaties, and immunities.
